english: to get out of bed; to wake up

etymology.description: 起 + 床 = get out of bed
etymology.interpretation: In context, '起床' refers to the act of rising from bed, often associated with beginning one's day. It combines the action of getting up with the noun for bed.

examples.chinese: 每天早上七点我准时起床。
examples.pinyin: Měitiān zǎoshang qī diǎn wǒ zhǔnshí qǐchuáng.
examples.english: I get out of bed at seven every morning.

examples.pinyin: Zhōumò wǒ huì wǎn yīdiǎn qǐchuáng.
examples.english: I usually get up a bit later on weekends.

examples.chinese: 他习惯早起床去锻炼(他習慣早起床去鍛鍊)。
examples.pinyin: Tā xíguàn zǎo qǐchuáng qù duànliàn.
examples.english: He is accustomed to getting up early to exercise.
